title: How to check the Bluetooth version on headphones and phone matches - Quora

response.answer_text: Read the specs from your equipment. The headphones have the specs on the box or papers they came with. You can also usually get them from the manufacturer website. Your phone can be done the same but also in the settings app there will be an “about phone” type button in the settings. Click it and it will list the radios including the Bluetooth version it has. You can also check it's manufacturer website for the specs and many smartphone review sites will often list them too. Without you saying what you have I can't tell you much more than this.

none of it matters. every version of Bluetooth is backwards compatible with all other versions. that doesn't mean everything will work perfectly, but the basics will always work. headphone, speakers you'll get audio. if it's not working perfectly, or at all, rtfm or look up how to reset the headphones.
